clay30.description: Clay is a useful proxy for defining the nutritional and biological capacity of soil.

asc.description: This is a 'best of' dataset of dominant soil order according to the Australian Soil Classification. Soil Order code list: 01. AN Anthroposol, 02. CA Calcarosol, 03. CH Chromosol, 04. DE Dermosol, 05. FE Ferrosol, 06. HY Hydrosol, 07. KA Kandosol, 08. KU Kurosol, 09. OR Organosol, 10. PO Podosol, 11. RU Rudosol, 12. SO Sodosol, 13. TE Tenosol, 14 .VE Vertosol.

pawc_1m.description: This index provides the maximum amount of plant available water a soil can provide. This is an indicator of a soil's ability to retain water and make it sufficiently available for plant use.

ph_0_30.description: Soil pH is a measure of the concentration of hydrogen ions in the soil solution. The lower the pH of soil, the greater the acidity. pH is measured on a logarithmic scale from 1 to 14, with 7 being neutral.

bd30.description: The soil bulk density, also known as dry bulk density, is the weight of dry soil divided by total soil volume. This is a useful indication of a soils physical condition.
